intro: Pedicularis ludwigii, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small monkeys. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on other plants for nutrients through its root system. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in botanical studies.
